head.title: Do We Expect Moral Leadership From a President?; Relentless Prosecutor

hedline.hl1: Do We Expect Moral Leadership From a President?; Relentless Prosecutor

abstract.p: Steve Israel letter, commenting on Jim Triggs Aug 1 letter on Monica Lewinsky probe, says Kenneth W Starr is relentless prosecutor (S)

block.p: Jim Triggs, in his Aug. 1 letter on the Monica S. Lewinsky investigation, states, ''Had Mr. Clinton come clean with the American people six months ago and not isolated himself, this would all be old news by now.'' Old news? When the Whitewater investigation reached a dead end and became old news, the special prosecutor, Kenneth W. Starr, simply veered in a different direction.

Jim Triggs, in his Aug. 1 letter on the Monica S. Lewinsky investigation, states, ''Had Mr. Clinton come clean with the American people six months ago and not isolated himself, this would all be old news by now.'' Old news? When the Whitewater investigation reached a dead end and became old news, the special prosecutor, Kenneth W. Starr, simply veered in a different direction.
Does anybody believe that if Ms. Lewinsky had never worked in the White House, Mr. Starr's investigators would be enjoying summer vacations right now?
